newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine stocks end weaker amid thin turnover.
newsitem.headline: Philippine stocks end weaker amid thin turnover.

text.p: * Value turnover falls short of one bln peso mark
Post-holiday blues dampened Philippine shares on Thursday, the first day of trading for the year, brokers said.
"Most people are still on vacation. There was no buying interest in the market," Caesar Tanquingcen, trader at Connell Securities, said.
The composite index fell 16.08 points, or 0.51 percent, to 3,154.48 points amid turnover of less than one billion pesos.
The market reopened on Thursday after a five-day New Year weekend.
Leading the decline was phone giant PLDT, which lost 70 pesos to close at 1,375 pesos on expectations of slower income growth this year due to a proposed cut in international call rate.
Tanquingcen said the present weakness in the market provided good opportunities to pick up oversold issues. Secondary food issues were among the biggest gainers during the day.
Keith Roy, a trader at PCIB Securities, said sluggish trading is expected to extend to tomorrow.
